Arithmetic mean is the average of a set of numbers. It is calculated by adding all the numbers in the set and then dividing the sum by the number of elements in the set. For example, the arithmetic mean of 5, 10, 15, and 20 is 12.5. This is calculated by adding 5 + 10 + 15 + 20 and then dividing the sum by 4 (the number of elements in the set). The result is 12.5.
